results.title: The Tap dance kid
results.creator_credit: Evelyn Barron, Learning Corporation of America and Barra Grant
results.brief_description:
Eight year old Willie Sheridan has a single passion - dancing. His twelve-year-old sister Emma wants to be a lawyer. When Willie, with Emma’s help, gets a chance to audition for summer stock, the entire family confronts the conflict between parents wishes and children’s dreams.
Based on the book “Nobody’s family is going to change” by Louise Fitzhugh.

results.title: The Tao of Steve
results.creator_credit: Anthony Bregman, Thunderhead Productions and Jenniphr Goodman
results.brief_description: Santa Fe primary school teacher Dex (Donal Logue) is a success with the ladies and he owes it all to Steve - Steve Austin, Steve McQueen, Steve McGarrett - the prototypical cool American male, he never has to impress the women but always gets the ladies. Dex and his entourage of single male friends (one is happily married), subscribe to the tao of Steve, valuing such ideals as suppressing that which you desire and doing something excellent in front of the ladies. Dex’s comfortable, philandering existence is thrown into turmoil when he meets Syd (Greer Goodman) - a conquest from his thinner, college years - whom, to his surprise, he discovers he is falling in love with, causing him to question the code by which he has lived his life thus far. A surprise sleeper at the 2000 Sundance Film Festival, Goodman’s directorial debut saw Donal Logue awarded with a Special Jury Prize.

results.title: The Tango lesson [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Christopher Sheppard, OKCK Films, PIE, Neue Deutsche Filmgesellschaft and Sally Potter
results.brief_description: Filmmaker Sally Potter returns to her dancing roots (‘The Golddiggers’ was her first musical) by casting herself as a film director suffering from writer’s block who sets out to take tango lessons from a Paris-based teacher (Pablo Veron, playing himself). Veron has always dreamed of being in a movie and Sally is starting to dream of a film about tango. Potter’s film is divided into twelve lessons during which the two protagonists learn about each other, fight over who is leading who, start a love story, and eventually end up in Buenos Aires to learn from the tango masters. The film is shot mostly in black and white, except for some dream sequences in which Sally fantasizes about an ill-fated film project. Veron performs many modern dance numbers, including tap and ballroom dancing, as part of his tango repertoire.

results.title: The Taming of the shrew
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring John Cleese as Petruchio and Sarah Badel as Katherina. The action of “The Taming of the Shrew” is set in the social context of Elizabethan mercantile upper-middle class, and like nearly all of Shakespeare’s comedies, is a family play dealing with the domestic processes of courtship and marriage.

results.title: The Talyrond
results.brief_description: The measurement of roundness in millionths of an inch plays a vital part in modern industry. Instruments like the Talyrond make it possible to attain precise measurements of roundness which help to produce increased mechanical efficiency. Use of the Talyrond illustrates the importance of roundness accuracy in bearings, cylinder bores, and splined shafts, and their applications in industries which include aircraft manufacture, ball bearings and watchmaking.

results.title: The Talkies : Australians at the movies 1930s style
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: The first of the “At the flicks” series, this video recaptures what it was like to go to the movies in Australia in the 1930s after the introduction of sound. It presents an evening’s viewing complete with interval and the National Anthem. Rediscover what going to the flicks used to be like, featuring “Clara Gibbings” (directed by Frank Thring Snr, 1934) and a Cinesound newsreel, the short film “Tap dancers” (starring Stan George and Ray Moon Jnr) and the Bela Lugosi short The Phantom Creeps.

results.title: The Talk of the town
results.brief_description: This zany romantic comedy, nominated for six Academy Awards stars Cary Grant as Leopold Dilg, a prison escapee who hides out in the home of schoolteacher Nora, played by Jean Arthur. Leopold enlists the help of Nora to try and convince her summer tenant, Supreme Court candidate Michael Lightcap (Ronald Colman), that Dilig was falsely imprisoned on the charge of arson. As the charming and persuasive fugitive and conservative lawyer share living arrangements they also find themselves sharing a growing affection for the beautiful schoolteacher.

results.title: The Taliban legacy
results.creator_credit: Montse Ayuso, Televisio de Catalunya and Joan Salvat
results.brief_description: Filmed just prior to the September 11 disaster, this documentary provides an inside look at the humanitarian crisis building on the Afghani/Pakistan borders where Afghani refugees were seeking shelter from drought and war and the oppressive regime of the Taliban. Since the Taliban gained control of Afghanistan in 1996, schools have been closed, women excluded from public life and a strict form of Islamic law enforced. The producers of this program visited Jalozai, in Pakistan, a makeshift camp without food, water or shelter which has become home to over 70,000 Afghani refugees whose plea for UN aid is ignored by the Pakistan government. Over a period of 20 years Pakistan has taken in 2 million refugees and has now decided to close its borders, along with other neighbouring border countries of Afghanistan. The plight of these refugees is graphically illustrated through film footage and interviews with Montserrat Felix (the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees), Francesc Vendrell (United Nations mediator), Taliban representatives including Ebdul Salam Zaeef (Ambassador of the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan in Pakistan) and several Afghani women refugees. Also covers a brief history of Afghanistan from 1978 onwards when Afghanistan was invaded by Soviet forces. Suitable for senior secondary and tertiary students. Teacher notes included.

results.title: The Tales of Hoffmann = les contes d'Hoffmann
results.brief_description: The poet Hoffmann (Placido Domingo) recounts the sad tale of his three past loves; Olympia, Giulietta and Antonia (sung by Illeana Cotrubas, Agnes Baltsa and Luciana Serra), and reveals how the evil influence of his rival drove the lovers apart. Conducted by Georges Pretre, music by Jacques Offenbach. Sung in French with English subtitles.
